rounds.comments: (Alex: You have to identify the novelist, uh, who wrote the words that I will be reading to you loud and clear.)

clues.text: "Tarzan... placed his foot upon the neck of his vanquished enemy, and... loud through the forest rang the fierce, wild cry"
"'What remains?' cried Ivanhoe. 'Glory, maiden, glory!'"
"'It's a wonderful knocker!--here's the turkey, hallo! Whoop! How are you! Merry Christmas!'"
"'Objection!' shouted Mitty's attorney. 'We have shown that the defendant could not have fired the shot'"
"'Only two kinds of daughters,' she shouted in Chinese. 'Those who are obedient and those who follow their own mind!'"
A haphazard mix of voices, or the Biblical tower noted for that
This unsystematic political system is from the Greek for "without a ruler"
It's pure this in here! This, being where all demons live, not cute black-&-white bamboo eaters
To muddle up, or a RWDO EZPZUL created in 1954
A scene of wild confusion, perhaps in the asylum dating back to the early 1400s
This redheaded royal co-founded an AIDS charity in Lesotho as a tribute to his late mother
Aid for wounded & mentally ill post-9/11 combat vets is given by the fund named for this shortened U.S. Marine Corps motto
To aid the homeless, give to key-shaped "parking meters" on the aptly named Wisconsin Avenue in this city
This org.'s red kettle began in 1891 as a repurposed crab pot at a ferry landing in San Francisco
Be generous when tossing coins into this fountain--it guarantees a return to Rome & is collected & donated to charity
In the 1960s N.Y. police car 54 & Scooby-Doo were asked this question in show titles
On a PBS game show for kids, this title question was sung a cappella at the beginning of every episode--did they ever find her?
clues.response: "Where in the world is Carmen Sandiego?"

clues.text: On NBC & then TLC, a genealogy show has asked celebrities this title question
Contestants on this game show didn't forget their dialogue--they were asking panelists to guess their occupations
John Qui√±ones asks this title question on ABC by taping staged hypothetical situations with hidden cameras
This Manitoba city was Fort Rouge, Fort Gibraltar & Fort Garry before they just gave up & named it for the nearby lake
Bangalore in this country began as a mud fort, later upgraded to stone
A fort named Khadzhibey on this sea became the Ukrainian city of Odessa
Fort Faithful on the Silk Road became Almaty, once capital of this country--very nice!
The French fort Lamy was upgraded to N'Djamena after this country became independent
In 1996 Trenton State College became the College of this state
In 1825 this author graduated from Maine's Bowdoin College, where he gambled, partied & didn't get scarlet As
In 1818 Daniel Webster argued before the Supreme Court to stop New Hampshire from taking over this private college
This Pennsylvania college was founded in 1832, 31 years before it served as a field hospital
In 1999 Harvard merged with this venerable women's school
If gardeners overdo this, it deprives the roots of oxygen & can lead to root rot
Black spot does what its name suggests, most commonly to the leaves of these beloved flowers' bushes
Ulmus hollandica Major is the scientific name for this tree in the name of a devastating disease
The gall type of this tiny arachnid can cause hairs, berrylike globes or other growths on your plants
This word for a disease that causes the plant to wither may be "early" or "late" when it afflicts potatoes

(7)

Handy with both hands

Herschel or Sagan
(10)
In a real estate listing, FDR stands for a "formal" this, probably only used a few times a year
Like "pad", this 3-letter word for a room was once often used after "bachelor"
It can mean just a room, or a gathering of intellectuals like that of Madame de Stael in the 1790s
About 19th century female writers, a 1979 classic of literary criticism is titled "The Madwoman in" this room
The kitchen named for this man is long & narrow, just like the kind you would find on one of his train cars

rounds.category: PUTTING THE VICE IN VICE PRESIDENT

clues.text: He was noticeably drunk at Lincoln's second inauguration; a little over a month later, he was president
John Breckinridge, veep to this president, 1857-1861, hightailed it out of the U.S. to escape treason charges
On Oct. 11, 1973 the New York Times said he "quits vice presidency and admits tax evasion in '67"
A 19th century man on the go, he was indicted for murder & later tried for treason
Schuyler Colfax, No. 2 to this military hero, got implicated in shady contracts to build the Union Pacific Railroad
"Haute" means this in French, as in haute trahison, this type of treason
In haute cuisine, bechamel, espagnole, hollandaise, tomato & veloute are the 5 "mother" these
You'll find this public university in Terre Haute
Haute ecole is the most elaborate form of this strict equestrian training, a longtime Olympic competition
The Chambre Syndicale de la Haute Couture includes Dior & the house founded by her, real name Gabrielle
While this Swahili word means "journey", it mentions nothing of big-game hunting
An "A" was added to the end of the Swahili word for "first" to name this December holiday
This word can mean "crocodile" in Swahili, but Kobe Bryant knows it means a snake to most of us
This game's name comes from a Swahili word meaning "to build"; oddly, the exact opposite happens in gameplay
Bob Hope was in a movie called "Call Me" this 5-letter word for "master"

rounds.text: Some devotees of this emperor who died in 1975 trace his lineage to King Solomon & the Queen of Sheba
